title: What music do you listen to when playing - looking for suggestions
body:
As title says, my playlist is getting boring, i want to give it new life

so, i wonder what you guys/gals are all listening to, maybe i'll find something new

Genre doesn't matter
although i'm partial to most forms of EDM and symphonic metal

replies.body: As the basic person that I am, I’ll listen to most things pop, with the occasional Disney song.

> [{quoted}](name=Wuks,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=LTmT5cv0,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-07-04T17:21:06.467+0000)
>
> As the basic person that I am, I’ll listen to most things pop, with the occasional Disney song.

Respectable (especially the Disney part :D)
When you say "symphonic metal", do you mean black metal?

> [{quoted}](name=QAPLA,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=LTmT5cv0,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-07-04T00:00:45.105+0000)
>
> When you say "symphonic metal", do you mean black metal?

Symphonic metal, is mostly orchestral sounds, combined with the beat of a metal song

for example, Nightwish, Epica... amongst others

Often has a fantasy feel to it, very atmospheric and lacks a certain loudness that other metal types have

This i guess?

Symphonic metal https://g.co/kgs/LsTX8m

I love oldschool industrial, Ministry are the best.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yaz5V6OFQlo

I think that's basically Black Metal, so I can make suggestions, as I dig that.

I love a band called Sigh, that is Japanese Avant-Garde Black Metal, yeah that's a mouthful of a sub-genre.
I'd start with https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3GmLBXvFjTg for Sigh, but it's all good.

If you like more atmospheric metal, try some Enslaved, real viking shit. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=coJ_O3YYcNY&t=2711s

If this isn't to your taste, I understand, I'm just trying to be helpful.
Encelevenemus -王の憐れみ- 下村陽
